getGuard

public String getGuard()
Description copied from interface: Node
Every node may have a guard associated with it. The guard may be blank or null, which by default, will be treated as an Accept. If it is not null or blank, the guard method may interpret it in some fashion. It may be a GuardLang statement, it could be some other script language or it could be interpreted in some other way entirely.

Specified by:
getGuard in interface Node
Returns:
The guard

public String getName()
Description copied from interface: Node
Returns the node name. Every node must have a name which is unique in it's process definition;

Specified by:

getType

public String getType()
Description copied from interface: Node
Every node has a type. The default is 'node'. Nodes of different types may have different (user defined) behavior when the execute method is invoked.

Specified by:
getType in interface Node
Returns:
The type

isJoin

public boolean isJoin()
Description copied from interface: Node
Return true if the node is a join node. When an arc token arrives at a join node, it will wait for arc tokens to be present all other arcs that have the same name before executing the node. When an arc token arrives at a non-join node it executes the node right away.

Specified by:
isJoin in interface Node
Returns:
True if the node is a join node

isStart

public boolean isStart()
Description copied from interface: Node
Returns true if this node is a start node. Start nodes will have a token placed in them when the process is started

Specified by:
isStart in interface Node
Returns:
True if the node is a start node.

guard

public GuardResponse guard(Engine engine,
                           NodeToken token)
Description copied from interface: Node
When a NodeToken is created, the associated Node will not automatically be executed. First, the guard function is called, which will indicate which action should be taken. The possible actions are:
  • GuardAction.DiscardToken: The token will be discard.
  • GuardAction.SkipNode: Skip the node. The Node.execute(Engine, NodeToken) method will not be called. The GuardResponse will indicate which arc(s) to leave on.
  • GuardAction.AcceptToken: Accept the token. The execute function of the Node will be called.

Specified by:
guard in interface Node
Parameters:
engine - The engine being used to execute the process
token - The node token which is currently entering a node
Returns:
A GuardResponse

execute

public void execute(Engine engine,
                    NodeToken token)
Description copied from interface: Node
Performs Node specific logic. Either from the execute method, or later from outside, the Engine.completeExecution(NodeToken, String) method must be called to continue executing the Process.

Specified by:
execute in interface Node
Parameters:
engine - The Engine which is performing the execution.
token - The NodeToken which is currently executing in this node.
